here is the files. Hope it can help a little. Please let me know what you find out.
xiaoyen

David Goodwin <dgoodwin@...> wrote: 
From what you describe, it is hard to know where the problem is. Maybe 
the equilibrium solver is having trouble converging. You can tell it 
to use the new solver by giving a third non-zero parameter to 
equilibrate, e.g.:

equilibrate(gas, 'TP', 1)

If the third paramter is missing or zero, the old solver will be used, 
which is faster but less stable than the new one. Equilibrium problem 
usually arise from specifying very hard initial conditions, like an 
exactly stoichiometric fuel/air mixture at 300 K. Nevertheless, the new 
solver should handle these cases.

Other than that, you will need to do some debugging to isolate the 
problem. Since the transport demo works, you can start with it and 
modify it one line at a time until it looks like your m-file that 
fails. In that way, you should be able to track down exactly what 
change causes failure. If it is not due to an initial condition and 
seems to be something in Cantera, then see how small an m-file you can 
create that still fails by removing extraneous lines. For example, 
does it fail if you only do equillibrium? Or do you need to compute 
transport propertiess for it to fail?

Once you have isolated the problem, send the short m-file to me, and I 
can see if it fails for me too, and see what the problem is.




On Apr 13, 2005, at 7:27 AM, xiao-yen wang wrote:

> Dear Prof. Goodwin:
>
> Two weeks ago I posted the following message:
>
> Hi, there: Recently I tried to run Cantera 1.5.5 with Matlab on PC. I
> need compute the transport properties of a gas mixture. I run the file
> transport1.m in the MATLAB/demos and it works fine. But when I run my
> own M file in which function equilibrate is used, I got different kind
> of error messages. Sometimes, it runs and gives me a reasonable result,
> sometimes, it runs and gives Nan for all transport properties, 
> sometimes
> it does not run and gives error message such as 'segmentation error'.
> Note that the code itself is the same. I just try run different times.
> It gives me different things. I guess it is related to memory. Any help
> to fix this will be highly appreciated. Thanks!
>
>
> I have not received any reply. My colleague had the similar problem. 
> We are in the process to incoporate Cantera into our system modleing 
> using Matlab. One of my colleague does NOT has problem because he has 
> the older version of Cantera. We need a solution to fix the problem. 
> Could you please look into this? Should we download the older version 
> of Cantera? And which version should we use?
>
> Thanks again!
>
> xiaoyen wang
>
>  
>
